awards.title: ITIL Expert
awards.description:
The ITIL® Expert level qualification is aimed at those who are interested in demonstrating knowledge of the ITIL Scheme in its entirety. The certificate is awarded to candidates who have achieved a range of ITIL qualifications and have achieved a well rounded, superior knowledge and skills base in ITIL Best Practices. 

This qualification will benefit you in both your personal and professional development, by aiding career advancement and progress within the IT Service Management field.

You also need to achieve the ITIL Expert level if you want to progress to the ITIL Master Level, which is the highest and final qualification within the ITIL scheme.

awards.title: Orange Belt LEAN SixSigma
awards.description:
Lean IT is the extension of lean manufacturing and lean services principles to the development and management of information technology (IT) products and services. Its central concern, applied in the context of IT, is the elimination of waste, where waste is; work that adds no value to a product or service

Voice of the Customer (VOC)
Critical to Quality / Customer requirements (critical customer requirements) (CTQ or CTC)
stakeholder analysis
Value stream mapping
Cause & Effect Diagram
Data analysis
Brainstorming
Decision Making Techniques
Solution Selection Matrix

awards.title: MCITP: Enterprise Desktop Administrator on Windows 7

profile_positions.description:
After completing my HBO study and obtaining the ITIL Expert certification, the opportunity presented itself within my company to put my new found knowledge directly to use.

I took on the job of "IT Asset and Configuration manager" given the goal to implement this process for all Vopak's divisions worldwide, extending future scope to include IOT and OT as well.

What exactly is Asset and Configuration Management?

The purpose of Asset Management is to manage activities that optimize the value, cost and risk of IT assets throughout their life cycle. 

The purpose of Configuration Management is to maintain accurate and current information on IT assets required to deliver a service; for which changes are controlled and life cycle is managed.


Some IT Goals are:
- Maintaining and providing accurate and current information of all IT assets in one place.
- Monitoring the IT asset life cycle through systematic process of planning, acquiring, deploying, managing and disposing of IT assets in a cost effective way.


Versus some Business Goals, to give you an idea of the added value:
- Contribute to efficient management of change and to high service availability (operational excellence).
- Optimize cost and value and reduce risk for all IT assets.

I find the below (sub) processes to be key within this process.
- CMDB
- Discovery
- Hardware Asset Management (HAM)
- Software Asset Management (SAM)
- Service Mapping (Asset Relations)
- IT Finance Management
- Life Cycle Management
- Organizational Data Management and Conventions
- Vendor Aligment
- Inventory and Disposal process
- Interfacing with ITIL process
- Reporting

In short as a company as well as an individual there is a need to keep track of your financials and maintain your belongings, so you can plan your future well and make it as bright as it can be!
profile_positions.title: IT Asset and Configuration Manager

profile_positions.description:
I've obtained various roles during these years within the company, which I've listed below.

Project Management
Project Manager:
Implementing follow me printing for all dutch locations, which will provide secure printing via access token and deliver: waste reduction lowering costs, secured printing, guest printing and improved reporting.

Project Roll-out Manager Windows 7:
Roll-out manager within the Windows 7 Upgrade Project in Holland, Belgium, Germany and Spain 
performing Project Management tasks and leading a team of 10 project employees.  
Resulting in successfully upgrading 1600 workstations across Europe and in the 
process improving; security, lowering costs, improving standardization and automation.


Service and Team Coordination
Global Service Coordinator for Printing and Client Software:
Responsible for global service coordination of Printing, Common Layer Software and Business Layer Software. In this role you provide a life cycle plan for these services and monitor and improve the quality of service. Further your responsible for allocation of budget and providing service improvement plans as well as initiating project charters for lifecycle activities.

Coordinator Enterprise System Administrators:
Responsible for Coordination of Operational IT Support in Holland, Belgium, Germany and Spain combining 2nd line IT Support. 
Also acting as replacement for Team Lead Global Service Desk & Workplace Support. 
In this role you aim to improve ITIL processes; Incident Management, Change Management, Problem Management, Life Cycle Management, Customer Relations Management, Service Management resulting in effective and efficient IT Support.
Taking on leadership for 2 departments with a total of 13 employees giving worldwide IT Support. 


Technical Project Employee
System administrator expert within a project team, with the task to setup the entire IT environment  for a new location in Spain. Implementing and extending the standard IT environment.
profile_positions.title: IT Enterprise Administrator and Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Medior System Administrator and Helpdesk Technician for Philips Medical Systems supporting large hospitals such as; UMC Utrecht Hospital, Erasmus Hospital Rotterdam, Catharina Hospital Eindhoven, Rijnstate Arnhem etc.

Performing on site and remote support for hospitals, especially critical departments such as; 
Operating rooms, Emergency rooms, Intensive care and off course all other departments. 

Resulting in a stable IT environment in places with high priority.
profile_positions.title: IT Support Employee 1st and 2nd line

profile_positions.description:
Enertel Division
System administrator for an upcoming Wi-Fi services company called Enertel, later on fused into KPN because of its leading Wi-Fi coverage in the Netherlands.

Providing support for internal company users (100+) and working hard on innovation regarding Wi-Fi technology.  

Besides support activities also assisted in the IT move off the company to KPN and later on became internal system administrator within KPN.
profile_positions.title: IT Support Employee 1st and 2nd line
